title: Applications of Finite Markov Chain Models to Management
description:
Markov Chains offer ideal conditions for the study and mathematical modelling
of a certain kind of situations depending on random variables. The basic
concepts of the corresponding theory were introduced by Markov in 1907 on
coding literary texts. Since then, the Markov Chain theory was developerd by a
number of leading mathematicians, such as Kolmogorov, Feller etc. However, only
from the 1960's the importance of this theory to the Natural, Social and most
of the other Applied Sciences has been recognized. In this review paper we
present applications of finite Markov Chains to management problems, which can
be solved, as most of the problems concerning applications of Markov chains in
general do, by distinguishing between two types of Chains, the Ergodic and the
Absorbing ones.
